author: henno
title: Open Source for the environment
description:
Nature is an externality of our economic system.
The quicker we can take everything from nature, the more profitable we will be.

f6_assessments.q0: The project proposes a new currency that will be correlated to nature through an aditional measurement compoent which varies depending on the way a product is being produced and wheather that process is destructive for the environment or not.  The impact depends on the adoption of this project, so the impact is very hard to measure by iteself. This project surely will help the cardano developer ecosystem with an example of a build Dapp. The proposal states how it will bring value, but it doesn't specify the cardano ecosystem. This project would have an even better fit in the DApps & Integrations challenge. If the proposal can scale with interest is entirely up to the author, but keeping in mind the stated experience, I see no issues in welcoming the challenges and potential growth.
f6_assessments.q1: The impact of this project depends on it's adoption. Most of all on product providers being honest when describing the process they use. This fact is a big flaw in the project for me. It is clear that the proposer has put a lot of though into it, but I also believe it's too idealistic of an approach to work in practice based on the videos posted on the youtube channel which state that the relation between how much you need to pay for a product would indirectly rely on a provider answering honestly about the origin of the water used to grow the product, the furtilizers used (destructive to the environment or not) and a series of a specific questions for each different kind of product. I see two main practical issues  which were not mentioned anywhere: 1. how will you guarantee providers will answer honestly to questions that will potentially be detremental for their business. 2. Who decides the questions asked for a specific product. Because of those two main reasons, I don't believe this product is feasable. If the proposer doesn't plan to bring a team together for future proposals buidling on top of this one and supporting it, it's going to be really hard to bring this idea into reality. The budget is broken down to identify the items, but I really feel like more funding would be necessary to clear the outlined goals. I'm speaking as a developer who has done some independant work simillar to the proposal. No timetable is offered in the proposal, so I'd say that's a critical pointt of improvement of this proposal. There is a vast description of the end goal in mind, which is great but I didn't find in the proposal were the concrete steps to get there and the timetable for the whole plan.  The technical aspects weren't detailed enough for me to undestand although I watched through several videos posted on the proposers channel. A whitepaper of some sort would have been great way to educate people of the actual implementation of the idea. The proposal only states that the tokenomics for this project is complex without further explanation. My suggestion would be to think about the relevant risks to a successful implementaion like: do I need a team? do I have the concrete steps, roadmap and timetable to complete the tasks?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer didn't mention any KPIs or a way to follow the progress of the proposal, so my suggestion would be to focus on clear practical examples and targeted KPIs to enable the cardano community to help and understand the whole idea of the project.  As mentioned there isn't a roadmap or milestones to speak of. I struggled to find a clear description of the question "how will I implement the project?". The solution seems great, but I didn't understand the plan for the actual implementation and business insentives.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is a novel and a Nobel attempt to create an open-source system that will enable value creation by following nature-preserving options in any walk of life. However, its direct impact on the open-source echo system is debatable. This proposal may have limited direct impact directly but may act as a catalyst to force the open-source community to delve more in this exciting area.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is developing a model to monetize nature preservation measures, this is a much-needed revolutionary concept and needs to be taken up. The proposer has been following the idea in a passionate manner and created a centralized website that is able to demonstrate the idea. This is a novel and complicated mechanism and needs substantial oracle support in a decentralized setting. The deliverables of the proposal are not explicit and may not create an immediately usable system.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has listed 7 features that he aims to develop in this fund these are clear software features and will be released in open-source. The project can be audited based on the quality and the number of deliverables successfully created. There is a need for creating more documentation on how the tokens can be made valuable and how they will be pegged to fiat.

f6_assessments.q0: Your statement, "The quicker we can take everything from nature, the more profitable we will be.". The above information would be easy to confuse the reader about your project's working progress intention if not read through your entire project. It should be clearer where and how the community will access your results output and the availability channel.
f6_assessments.q1: With 20 years plus in database development back and front and website design and implementor. I am not quite sure why your crucial performance and course breakdown only create a small website functionality, draw some pictures on objects and research, research, and a small questionnaire to be developed for $4380. I believe you would deliver better with your skill-set in database and web services. As the proposer stated, it is a proof of concept. I think in the next three months, with the key performance indicator, the proposer would be able to deliver the promised PKIs.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer should have highlighted clearly whether the community will benefit from your project available in Cardano ecosystem open-source packages or your project using available open-source resources for your project. Once the progress is evident and nailed down agenda, the committee has a more transparent view to audit your project progress. This also helps the current Fund 7 Challenge team easier to make a report for the next three months if your project is being funded.
